title.narrative: 4. STRENGTHENED CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEMS AND DATA

description.narrative: By 2022, actors in child protection are equipped with and use a functional data collection and management system to inform decision- making and monitor interventions at the communal level., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, actors in child protection are equipped with and use a functional data collection and management system to informdecision- making and monitor interventions at the communal level.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s support enabled three ministries - justice, security and social action - to produce and publish their annual statistical yearbooks, thus improving the governance of the sector. In addition, the political and technical dialogues facilitated by UNICEF influenced the Government decision to apply the technological version V2.0 of CPIMS + Primero. This decision resulted in the involvement of non-governmental organizations as users of the CPIMS +, including on case management, thereby strengthening the partnership and alliance for child rights including the protection rights | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
